data.event: Despite losing $2.1 billion in revenue for 2008, American Airlines announced Monday that its subsidiary, American Eagle, would introduce six new regional services, including one from Manhattan Regional Airport.

event.title: Monday, American Airlines representative Dale Morris joked

data.event: At a news conference Monday, American Airlines representative Dale Morris joked about the company not having gone bankrupt and said that a year ago, high fuel prices would not have permitted the new route from Manhattan to Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport.

At a news conference Monday, American Airlines representative Dale Morris joked about the company not having gone bankrupt and said that a year ago, high fuel prices would not have permitted the new route from Manhattan to Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport.

They are expected to cost, one-way, about $40 to $100 more than a flight from Kansas City International to Dallas, when purchased two to three weeks in advance, said Richard Jankovich, airport advisory board chairman.
